source.c7c77676:
import plotly.graph_objects as go

fig = go.Figure()

for idx in range(10):
    fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(
        x = mnist_umap[:,0][label==idx],
        y = mnist_umap[:,1][label==idx],
        name=str(idx),
        opacity=0.6,
        mode='markers',
        marker=dict(color=color[idx])
        
    ))

fig.update_layout(
    width = 800,
    height = 800,
    title = "UMAP result",
    yaxis = dict(
      scaleanchor = "x",
      scaleratio = 1
    ),
    legend=dict(
        orientation="h",
        yanchor="bottom",
        y=1.02,
        xanchor="right",
        x=1
    )
)


fig.show()

## Umap & Result

- [UMAP: Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection for Dimension Reduction](https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.03426)

Depending on the data, UMAP is faster than TSNE and shows tremendous clustering capabilities.

**UMAP** stands for Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection.
